articles.author: JB, FinOps Product Dept. Director & Core CS Team Lead
articles.description:
New!
¬†¬†
Today, we are glad to announce yet a new feature: a brand new Dashboard section that will allow you to easily manage your daily tasks, directly from your Smily account.
Here is a sneak peek at what the new Dashboard looks like:

In the past, managing day to day operations may have been complicated. Tasks such as keeping track of payments, approving pending tentatives and others were time consuming.
Thanks to the Dashboard, you now have access to the following information:
List of pending tentatives: to help you convert them into confirmed bookings, or cancel them to free up the dates in your calendar
List of bookings with missing payments: to help you get all your payments on time and never miss a payment again
List of arrivals of the day: to help you plan the check-in of your guests
List of departures of the day: to help you plan the check-out of your guests
You can find more details in the dedicated manual article, and a video guided tour of the new Dashboard section will soon be added there as well.
We invite you to explore this new Dashboard, and hope it will help you save time and better manage your daily operations. Some improvements will also be made in the future, such as adding performance metrics to help you manage your business more easily.
articles.title: [New feature] Brand new Dashboard section to easily manage your daily tasks from Smily üöÄ

articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
New!
¬†¬†
At BookingSync, we are here to make you Save time and Book more. That's why we are always thrilled to announce more and more features.
This time the new feature concerns the reviews management, you can now manage all your reviews on BookingSync. Yes ! all the reviews posted on the biggest channels : Airbnb, Booking.com plus your direct bookings.
When accessing the Reviews section, you will see 2 different sub-menus:
Guest Reviews: This section will allow you to see the different reviews posted by the guests for each property, the rating plus the message posted by the guest, if you need more detail you can click on the review, a new page will appear with the Review details, the Booking details, the complete guest review message, and the host review if it‚Äôs already posted, and you have the possibility to reply to the review message.


Host Reviews: This section will allow you to evaluate your guest and share a detailed rating and a review message.


For each of these section you will be able to filter the reviews by Rating, Rentals and Source.
Please find here the video demo explaining step by step the feature.
We invite you to discover all these new features, and hope it will help you to have a better management of your reviews, save more time, and have a better ranking and visibility on the channels !
Don‚Äôt hesitate to contact our customer care if you have any questions.
articles.title: [New feature] Manage all your reviews from your BookingSync Account !

Resolved - From 13:50 - 14:50 UTC, our Engineering team observed issues with event processing in all regions. During this time, users may have experienced delays or failures when attempting to process events, such as creation, deletion, resizing, assigning of Reserved IP's, Snapshots, and other Droplet-based events.

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-04 04:00 and ended at 2022-09-07 14:36 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

INCIDENT REPORT

Summary:

On Saturday, 03 September 2022 21:00 US/Pacific, Google Calendar experienced an issue with a mismatch in Daylight Savings time in Chile for a duration of 3 days, 22 hours, 36 minutes. The issue was mitigated on Wednesday, 07 September 2022 07:36 US/Pacific. We have conducted an internal investigation and are taking steps to improve our service.

Root Cause:

Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (also known as IANA) is a standards organization that oversees global IP address allocation, autonomous system number allocation, root zone management in the Domain Name System (DNS), media types, and other Internet Protocol-related symbols and Internet numbers. As part of its mission, IANA maintains global time zone information [1], commonly known as the time zone database, the Olson time zone database, or just the ‚Äútzdb‚Äù. This database is not released on a schedule, just when global time zone changes require it.

Chile had a scheduled time zone change on Sunday, 04 September 2022. However, because of elections occurring around the same time, the government decided to postpone the start date of Daylight Savings time from Sunday, 04 September 2022 to Sunday, 11 September 2022. The Chilean government announced this decision on 08 August 2022, less than a month in advance.

IANA released version 2022b of the time zone database on Thursday, 11 August 2022, followed by 2022c (to address technical issues) on Tuesday, 16 August 2022. Google integrates new versions of the time zone database as they become available in a multi-step process involving several teams. It takes approximately one month for time zone database changes to roll out for Google Calendar.

[1] - https://www.iana.org/time-zones

Remediation

Google engineers expedited a roll out of the new time zone definitions on the morning of Wednesday, 07 September 2022 (local Chilean time). This had the following effects:

  • The current time in Calendar (the red bar) would be correct.
  • New events would appear at the correct time and be in the correct time zone.
  • Appointment schedules would appear at the correct time.
  • Modified recurring events would appear at the correct time, but instance-specific data (ie. attendee, attendee status, description, location, time, etc.) which did not match the timezone definition would be deleted and new instances would be created in the correct time zone.

Prevention

Google is committed to preventing recurrence by implementing the following action items:

  • Implement improvements to the time zone updates rollout process that will reduce the lead time for completion.
  • Investigate Calendar interactions with other Workspace products with relation to mismatched time zones to minimize impact in case of a recurrence.

Detailed Description of Impact:

From 03 September 2022 21:00 to 07 September 2022 07:36 US/Pacific, Google Calendar events for all customers in Chile were impacted due to the time change event.

The customer impact included:

  • The current time in Calendar (the red bar) was out of sync with actual time and the operating system.
  • New and existing events were at the wrong time.
  • Appointments were set at the wrong time.
  • Appointments created across time zones displayed at the wrong time.
  • Updating appointment schedules displayed at the wrong time.
  • Mobile applications and devices displayed events at the wrong time.

Affected products: Google Calendar
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Google Calendar affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Sep 6, 2022, 7:07 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change.

articles.description:
Issue summary:


Starting September 6th, 2022, we identified an issue with the Google Sheet app inside Workflow Builder. This issue caused the app to read the spreadsheet date/time format wrong, inserting the incorrect time value in the timestamp.


We discovered this was due to the app processing the workflow step with a single digit value instead of a double digit value.


Users can continue highlighting the Submission Time column in the spreadsheet and select Format ‚Üí Number ‚Üí Custom Number Format and insert: ddd mmm yyyy hh:mm:ss, as a workaround.


We will work to fix this through a bug ticket that has been filed as a result of this incident. Though we have not resolved this issue yet, we will provide further updates through customer support tickets with the impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Spreadsheet data added using workflows may be incorrect

articles.description: Thank you for your patience while we were working on this. For now, we will track this internally as a bug while we continue to find resolution. If you‚Äôre still experiencing this behaviour, please reach out to us at¬†feedback@slack.com.
articles.title: Incident: Some users might have trouble with posts

articles.description:
Issue summary:


On September 13, 2022 from 10:33 AM PDT to 3:21 PM PDT, some customers were unable to see group direct messages in their sidebars due to a recent update. Reverting the update fixed the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Direct Messages with three or more people are missing from the Direct Message list for all workspaces

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On September 1st, 2022 from around 6:28 am to September 7th, 2022 around 3:00 pm PDT, some users on the Slack desktop app version 4.28.171 installed via the Windows Store were receiving an error when attempting to connect to Slack. 


We determined the cached information typically used to launch the app became corrupted, and subsequently caused the app to not load through a network request, prompting an error instead of re-trying the connection. We then launched a fix that allowed the app to re-attempt a network request, which solved the issue.
articles.title: Incident: Windows Store app users may experience an error when launching Slack

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On September 8th, 2022 from around 6:44 AM to 7:10 AM PDT some users on desktop clients experienced issues with drafting their messages and saw unexpected character replacements when links with quotes were used. This was caused by an update that was launched and reverting it fixed the issue for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may experience issues drafting a message that contains a link/hyperlink

articles.description:
Our service provider has resolved the issue and email ticket creation is now working as expected. 


Thank you for your patience while we sorted this out.
articles.title: Notice: Email ticket creation may not be working.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From August 31, 2022 at 7:24 PM PDT to September 1, 2022 at 12:15 AM PDT, some customers experienced visual trouble with the Slack interface. Multiple message attachments overlapped, making them inaccessible. 


We traced this to a recent code change, which we reversed ‚Äî resolving trouble for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with the Slack interface

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From Monday August 29 at 10:11 AM PDT to Wednesday August 31st at 12:42 PM PDT, some Grid customers were running into errors when configuring SSO settings for their workspaces. Upon investigation, we identified an issue that was resulting in empty SAML configuration files. These empty files triggered the errors seen by users.


Removing the offending file fixed the issue for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Issues setting up SSO for some users.

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

From August 29, 2022 at 11:26 AM PDT to August 30, 2022 at 3:56 PM PDT, some customers may have experienced issues with their Mark as Read preferences, and intermittent issues loading channel history.


When you view a channel, Slack remembers your last scroll position so we can take you back to the same place. A recent feature update inadvertently bypassed the check for this scroll position, creating the impression that Slack wasn't respecting your Mark as Read preference. Additionally, this incorrectly prevented channel history from loading for some users.


We identified the root cause and rolled this code change back, resolving the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Mark as Read preferences not being respected

articles.description:
Issue Summary: 

On August 25, 2022 between 11:31 AM PDT and 12:37 PM PDT, some customers experienced trouble loading the Workflow Builder screen.


We traced the problem to a change in the front-end Workflow Builder components which prevented the Workflow Builder from starting up successfully. We reverted this, resolving the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Workflow Builder screen not loading

articles.description:
Issue Summary:

From August 22, 2022 5:15 PM PDT to August 23, 2022 01:15 AM PDT, some customers experienced a persistent reload prompt when when their user account was converted from a member account to a guest account, even after a reload was completed.


A recent change made to our code resulted in the removal of a mechanism for indicating when a reload dialogue should appear. We have pushed a fix for this problem by reinstating the mechanism to ensure this only occurs for users once.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are encountering a "Reload required" message

articles.description:
Issue Summary:


On August 23, 2022 between 12:17 PM PDT and 1:32 PM PDT, some customers experienced difficulty with loading Slack and sending messages. This occurred when a group of database servers became overloaded and failed.


We first reduced the load on our infrastructure manually. The issue was then resolved when our automated processes kicked in, replacing the damaged server with a healthy one. While the issue is resolved, we will continue to investigate the root cause to avoid these problems in the future.
articles.title: Incident: Trouble loading and sending messages in Slack

articles.description:
Issue Summary: 

From August 19, 2022 11:55 AM PDT to August 22, 2022 2:52 AM PDT some users experienced issues using the buttons on interactive messages. 


We traced the issue to a recent code change, which we rolled back, resolving the issue for all impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Errors with interactive messages
